New Records: David Fry blasted a two-run homer in the seventh inning and added a run-scoring sacrifice bunt in the ninth.
Key Match Events: Cleveland earned its first playoff win since 1997 by defeating Detroit 5-4.
Fryâ€™s 382-foot blast to left-center came on a 2-2 count, scoring Steven Kwan from second base.
Pre-Game Insights: The Guardians had 11 hits in the game and snapped a 20-inning scoreless streak in the first inning.Jose Ramirez belted his first home run of the postseason in the fifth inning.
Post-Match Reflections: The victory snapped a 20-year championship drought for the Guardians.The series is now tied 2-2, forcing a deciding Game 5 in Cleveland.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The winner will face either the New York Yankees or Kansas City Royals in the ALCS.The game marked the end of a long losing streak for the Guardians.
